snippet: Foreign lenders say Greece has fallen short of its tax collection targets and is still not moving hard enough to tackle widespread, long-tolerated tax evasion.
abstract: Greece's foreign lenders say firestorm over tax scandal surrounding former Finance Min George Papaconstantinou has diverted attention from bigger problem of country falling woefully short of its tax collection targets; also cite fact that Greece is still not moving hard enough to tackle widespread tax evasion.

byline.original: By LIZ ALDERMAN and RACHEL DONADIO
byline.contributor: Liz Alderman reported from Paris, and Rachel Donadio from Rome. Niki Kitsantonis contributed reporting from Athens.

lead_paragraph: Foreign lenders say Greece has fallen short of its tax collection targets and is still not moving hard enough to tackle widespread, long-tolerated tax evasion.

headline.seo: Greece Tax Scandal Shifts Focus From Collection Problem
headline.main: Greek Tax Scandal Distracts From a Collection Shortfall
headline.print_headline: Greek Tax Scandal Diverts Attention From the Country’s Shortfall in Collections
